original: gang gas kyang mthang bar ma gyur to //
analyzed: gang gas kyang mthang bar ma gyur to //

translated: liberating from all fears.

original: de bas na 'dod chags kyi dbugs 'byin pa la de skad bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags kyi dbugs 'byin pa la de skad bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the exhalation of passion is called that.

original: 'o na 'bras bu ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the result?

original: smin ma khro gnyer bsdus pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: smin ma khro gnyer bsdus pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The eyebrows are called wrinkled with anger

original: sku gsum gyis 'gro ba'i don byed pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sku gsum gyis 'gro ba'i don byed pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: because they are suitable for the benefit of beings through the three bodies.

original: rnam par dag cing sku gsum gyi 'bras bu dang ldan pa la bstod pa'o //🔽padma dang chu lhas lag pa dang dpung pa brgyan pa zhes bya ba ni sprul dkar pos so //
analyzed: rnam par dag cing sku gsum gyi 'bras bu dang ldan pa la bstod pa'o // padma dang chu lhas lag pa dang dpung pa brgyan pa zhes bya ba ni sprul dkar pos so //
translated: This is the praise of the one who is pure and endowed with the result of the three bodies.🔽The arms and shoulders are adorned with white snakes and water deities, which is to say, with white snakes.

original: nor rgyas dang dung skyong gis dbu la brgyan zhes bya ba ni cod pan byas pa'o //🔽sprul rin po che @233a * //
analyzed: nor rgyas dang dung skyong gis dbu la brgyan zhes bya ba ni cod pan byas pa'o // sprul rin po che @233a * //
translated: The head is adorned with Vāsuki and Śaṅkhapāla, which is to say, a crown is made of them.

original: 'bar ba cod pan thogs pa ni sprul de bzhi la rna ba'i steng na rin po che 'bar ba'i 'od dang bcas pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba cod pan thogs pa ni sprul de bzhi la rna ba'i steng na rin po che 'bar ba'i 'od dang bcas pa yod pa'o //
translated: The snakes are adorned with blazing jewels, which is to say, on the ears of those four snakes there is a blazing jewel with light.

original: de yang con pan byas pa'i nor bu ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: de yang con pan byas pa'i nor bu ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu 'bar ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the jewel that is made into a crown is a blazing wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: gzhan gyi nor bu ni mthon ka dang / padma r'a ga dang / aindra n'i la'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor bu ni mthon ka dang / padma r'a ga dang / aindra n'i la'o //
translated: The other jewels are sapphire, ruby, and emerald.

original: klu dga' bo dang nye dga' bo 'bar bas snyan cha byas pa zhes bya ba ni sprul dmar po gnyis so //
analyzed: klu dga' bo dang nye dga' bo 'bar bas snyan cha byas pa zhes bya ba ni sprul dmar po gnyis so //
translated: The two blazing nāgas Nanda and Upananda serving as earrings are two red snakes.

original: 'bar pa ni sbyi gtsug na padma r'a ga 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: 'bar pa ni sbyi gtsug na padma r'a ga 'bar ba'o //
translated: Blazing means that a blazing padmarāga is on the top of the head.

original: rkang pas sprul gdug pa 'bar ba mnan zhing za ba /
analyzed: rkang pas sprul gdug pa 'bar ba mnan zhing za ba /
translated: Standing on a blazing poisonous snake with his foot, eating it

original: klu'i rgyal po 'dab bzangs ska rags su bcings shing /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po 'dab bzangs ska rags su bcings shing /
translated: means that the nāga king Suparṇa is bound at the waist.

original: klu nag po se ral khar thogs pa zhes bya ba ni stobs kyi rgyu dang ; / rigs ldan gnyis nag po khar ba bcug nas se ral khar drangs pa ste //
analyzed: klu nag po se ral khar thogs pa zhes bya ba ni stobs kyi rgyu dang ; / rigs ldan gnyis nag po khar ba bcug nas se ral khar drangs pa ste //
translated: The black nāga held under the arm means that the two black Balabhadra and Kṛṣṇa are held under the arm.

original: kha nas dug nag po 'phro ba sbyi bo na aindra n'i la'i nor bu ljang nag 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: kha nas dug nag po 'phro ba sbyi bo na aindra n'i la'i nor bu ljang nag 'bar ba'o //
translated: Black poison emanates from the mouth, and a dark green indranīla jewel blazes on the head.

original: des ni zhe sdang can 'dul bar byed pa'i mtshan ma'o //🔽bzhin rgyas pa ya sos ma mchu mnan pa zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'am /
analyzed: des ni zhe sdang can 'dul bar byed pa'i mtshan ma'o // bzhin rgyas pa ya sos ma mchu mnan pa zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'am /
translated: This is the sign of subduing the hateful.🔽The smiling face with the upper teeth biting the lower lip means that method and wisdom are inseparable.

original: dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: dbyings dang ye shes gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: Or it means that the dhātu and pristine consciousness are nondual.

original: rgyas pas ni bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pas ni bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du rgyas pa'o //
translated: By expanding, it expands into the nature of the exalted wisdom of great bliss.

original: de'i don ni 'dod chags can 'dul bar byed pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni 'dod chags can 'dul bar byed pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is that it has the sign of subduing those with desire.

original: gshin rje'i cha byad ni sku che ba dang / shin tu khros pa'o //
analyzed: gshin rje'i cha byad ni sku che ba dang / shin tu khros pa'o //
translated: The form of Yama is a large body and great wrath.

original: de dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das de ni phyin ci log la zhugs pa la khros shing ljags 'khyug pa dang / gsus pa 'khyil zhing sprul za bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das de ni phyin ci log la zhugs pa la khros shing ljags 'khyug pa dang / gsus pa 'khyil zhing sprul za bar ston pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat with that form is wrathful to those who have entered error, and he shows his tongue darting out, his belly swollen, and he devours snakes.

original: de'i don ni gshin rje ni phyin ci log gi gang zag la bya la /
analyzed: de'i don ni gshin rje ni phyin ci log gi gang zag la bya la /
translated: The meaning of that is that Yama is a person who has entered error.

original: de la shes rab kyi snang ba ston par byed pas na gsung gi sgo nas snang ba bskyed pa'i glog go //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi snang ba ston par byed pas na gsung gi sgo nas snang ba bskyed pa'i glog go //
translated: Since he shows the light of wisdom to that person, he is the lightning that generates light through speech.

original: gsus pa ni yangs pa yin la /
analyzed: gsus pa ni yangs pa yin la /
translated: The belly is vast.

original: sprul ni gti mug gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sprul ni gti mug gi rang bzhin no //
translated: The snake is the nature of delusion.

original: de 'joms par byed pa la za ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'joms par byed pa la za ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The one who conquers that is called “devourer.”

original: des ni gti mug can 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: des ni gti mug can 'dul ba'o //
translated: That is the subduing of those with delusion.

original: de ltar dug gsum 'dul bar byed pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pa'i bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dug gsum 'dul bar byed pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pa'i bstod pa'o //
translated: Thus, he is praised as having the signs that subdue the three poisons.

original: 'o na yon tan gyi khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yon tan gyi khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What are the special qualities?

original: rgya mtsho'i zabs su dpag tshad brgyad khri bzhi stong yod pa rkang pa'i bus mor phyin ba zhes bya ba ni sku'i tshad bston pa ste /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i zabs su dpag tshad brgyad khri bzhi stong yod pa rkang pa'i bus mor phyin ba zhes bya ba ni sku'i tshad bston pa ste /
translated: The phrase he reaches the bottom of the ocean with his big toe indicates the size of his body.

original: shin tu che zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu che zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that he is very large.

original: dbang po dang nyi ma'i steng na bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbang po dang nyi ma'i steng na bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase he stands on Indra and the sun indicates that.

original: dbang po ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi brgya byin dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi tshangs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi brgya byin dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi tshangs pa ste /
translated: Indra is the lord of the desire realm and Brahma is the lord of the form realm.

original: kha sbus tu @233b bsnol ba'i tshangs pa'i phrag pa'i steng na zla ba nya gang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha sbus tu @233b bsnol ba'i tshangs pa'i phrag pa'i steng na zla ba nya gang ba lta bu'o //
translated: He stands on the shoulders of Brahma, who is sitting cross-legged, like a full moon.

original: brgya byin gyi phrag pa'i steng na nyi ma ste /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi phrag pa'i steng na nyi ma ste /
translated: He stands on the shoulders of Indra, who is like the sun.

original: de gnyis kyi steng na bzhugs pa ni brkyang bskum du bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi steng na bzhugs pa ni brkyang bskum du bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He stands on the shoulders of those two, in a stretched out posture.

original: lag pa brdabs pa'i sgras 'jigs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lag pa brdabs pa'i sgras 'jigs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase he frightens with the sound of his hand clap indicates that.

original: stobs phul du byung ba ste /
analyzed: stobs phul du byung ba ste /
translated: He has the most excellent power,

original: lag pa brdabs pas 'jig rten gyi khams rlig par byed pa'i stobs mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: lag pa brdabs pas 'jig rten gyi khams rlig par byed pa'i stobs mnga' ba'o //
translated: the power to shake the world systems with the clap of his hands.

original: aa la la zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la ngo mtshar ba'am /
analyzed: aa la la zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la ngo mtshar ba'am /
translated: A la la means astonishing emptiness or astonishing disciples.

original: gdul bya la ngo mtshar ba'i sgra bsgrags pas skrag par byed pa zhes bya ba ni sa bla dang sa steng ngo //
analyzed: gdul bya la ngo mtshar ba'i sgra bsgrags pas skrag par byed pa zhes bya ba ni sa bla dang sa steng ngo //
translated: Terrifying means that he terrifies the gods of the heaven of the Pure Abodes and the gods of the heaven of Controlling Others' Emanations with the sound of his laughter.

original: klu rnams rlog par byed ces pa ni sa 'og na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: klu rnams rlog par byed ces pa ni sa 'og na gnas pa'o //
translated: He destroys the nagas means that he destroys the nagas who live in the underworld.

original: de rnams gad mo drag po sgrogs pa'i bcom ldan 'das sku de dang ldan pa'i gad rgyangs chen po dgod des rlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams gad mo drag po sgrogs pa'i bcom ldan 'das sku de dang ldan pa'i gad rgyangs chen po dgod des rlog par byed pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat, who possesses that body, destroys them with his great laughter, which is the sound of his loud laughter.

original: 'o na phrin las ni mi mnga'i 'am zhe na /🔽kun du 'khrugs par byed cing gshin rje'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: 'o na phrin las ni mi mnga'i 'am zhe na / kun du 'khrugs par byed cing gshin rje'i gzugs can no //
translated: But does he not have any activity?🔽 He is very agitated and has the form of the Lord of Death.

original: khams gsum 'jigs par byed pa /
analyzed: khams gsum 'jigs par byed pa /
translated: He terrifies the three realms means that he terrifies the gods of the desire realm and the form realm.

original: klu rnam 'dul bar byed pa zhes bya pa ni kun du 'khrugs par byed pa'i sku de las 'od zer kun du 'khrugs shing 'phro ba de las sprul pa dpag tu med pa phyag na rdo rje lta bu'i sprul pa 'phro bas na gshin rje'i gzugs can /
analyzed: klu rnam 'dul bar byed pa zhes bya pa ni kun du 'khrugs par byed pa'i sku de las 'od zer kun du 'khrugs shing 'phro ba de las sprul pa dpag tu med pa phyag na rdo rje lta bu'i sprul pa 'phro bas na gshin rje'i gzugs can /
translated: The one called “tamer of the nagas” is the body that agitates, from which light rays are agitated and radiate. From that, through the emanation of immeasurable emanations like Vajrapani, he has the form of the Lord of Death.

original: sa 'og sa stengs sa bla gsum 'jigs par byed pas khams gsum 'jigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'og sa stengs sa bla gsum 'jigs par byed pas khams gsum 'jigs par byed pa'o //
translated: He terrifies the three realms, the underworld, the earth, and the heavens.

original: de yang gdul bya rnam pa gsum 'dul bar byed pas na /
analyzed: de yang gdul bya rnam pa gsum 'dul bar byed pas na /
translated: Moreover, he is the tamer of the three types of disciples.

original: klu rnams 'dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: klu rnams 'dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the tamer of the nagas.

original: de'i phyir de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, “I pay homage to him” means

original: bcom ldan 'das de la byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rjes phyag 'tshal nas spobs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir na phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de la byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rjes phyag 'tshal nas spobs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir na phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: that the bodhisattva Vajrapani, having paid homage to that Bhagavat, is eloquent, and therefore he says “I pay homage.”

original: de la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rjes bstod nas gsung du gsol zhes smras pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rjes bstod nas gsung du gsol zhes smras pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva Vajrapani, having praised, says “please speak.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas kyi bdud kyi khang pa de nyid tu ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas kyi bdud kyi khang pa de nyid tu ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa ni /
translated: Then, the Bhagavān entered into samādhi in the very palace of Māra in the Heaven of Controlling Others’ Emanations.

original: de nas nam mkha' de nyid la gzhal yas khang dang zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi 'phrul pas bdud kyi khang pa de nyid gzhal yas khang du sprul te /
analyzed: de nas nam mkha' de nyid la gzhal yas khang dang zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi 'phrul pas bdud kyi khang pa de nyid gzhal yas khang du sprul te /
translated: Then, in that very sky, the celestial mansion and so on means that by the magic of samādhi, the very palace of Māra was emanated as a celestial mansion.

original: gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
analyzed: gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
translated: It has four sides and four gates,

original: 'khor lo rtsibs bzhis rnam par mdzes //
analyzed: 'khor lo rtsibs bzhis rnam par mdzes //
translated: beautified by four spoked wheels,🔽with nets and half-nets,

original: dra ba dra ba phyed pa dang // bdud rnams 'dul bar tva ra na'o //
analyzed: dra ba dra ba phyed pa dang // bdud rnams 'dul bar tva ra na'o //
translated: and tvaṃraṇa for subduing the māras.

original: dharma dh'a tu nam mkha'i dkyil //
analyzed: dharma dh'a tu nam mkha'i dkyil //
translated: The realm of phenomena is the center of space,

original: dur khrod 'jigs pa'i dbus su'o //
analyzed: dur khrod 'jigs pa'i dbus su'o //
translated: in the middle of the terrifying charnel ground.

original: 'khor lo chen po'i @234a * //
analyzed: 'khor lo chen po'i @234a * //
translated: The great wheel

original: ting nge 'dzin dang lhan pa'i drag po chen pos 'khor bsdus nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang lhan pa'i drag po chen pos 'khor bsdus nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is the great wrathful one who gathers the retinue with the samādhi.

original: gzhal yas khang de'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das phyan na rdo rje zhal gsum pa ste /
analyzed: gzhal yas khang de'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das phyan na rdo rje zhal gsum pa ste /
translated: In the center of that celestial mansion, the Bhagavān is Caṇḍa-vajra with three faces.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dbang du sdud pa'i zhal g-yas g-yon dkar po dang dmar ser dbus mthing nag gti mug can 'dul ba'i zha lo //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dbang du sdud pa'i zhal g-yas g-yon dkar po dang dmar ser dbus mthing nag gti mug can 'dul ba'i zha lo //
translated: The faces to the right and left of the desire and form realms are white and orange, and the central face is dark blue, subduing the ignorant.

original: yang na khros pa dang / bzhad pa dang / gtsigs pas drag po gsum 'dul bar byed pa /
analyzed: yang na khros pa dang / bzhad pa dang / gtsigs pas drag po gsum 'dul bar byed pa /
translated: Alternatively, the three fierce ones are subdued by the wrathful, laughing, and grimacing faces.

original: yang na gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyis bdud kyi gtso bo'i cha lugs 'dzin pas bdud dbang du sdud pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: yang na gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyis bdud kyi gtso bo'i cha lugs 'dzin pas bdud dbang du sdud pa'i rtags so //
translated: Or else, since he assumes the attire of the chief of the māras of the Paranirmita-vaśavartin Heaven, this is a sign of subduing the māras.

original: phyag drug ni rdo rje rtse lnga pa dang / sdigs mdzub pa dang / bar ma gnyis thal mo rdebs pa /
analyzed: phyag drug ni rdo rje rtse lnga pa dang / sdigs mdzub pa dang / bar ma gnyis thal mo rdebs pa /
translated: The six arms hold a five-pronged vajra, a threatening mudra, and the two middle ones clap.

original: tha ma gnyis sprul za ba /
analyzed: tha ma gnyis sprul za ba /
translated: The two lower ones eat snakes.

original: zhabs bzhis nyi zla dang tshangs pa dang / brgya byin mnan pa /
analyzed: zhabs bzhis nyi zla dang tshangs pa dang / brgya byin mnan pa /
translated: The four feet trample the sun and moon and Brahmā and Indra.

original: stag gi sha ma thabs dang / rigs bzhi'i klus sku la brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: stag gi sha ma thabs dang / rigs bzhi'i klus sku la brgyan pa'o //
translated: The skin of a tigress is his upper garment, and the four classes of nāgas adorn his body.

original: gang gi bstod pa'i yon tan sku la rdzogs pa'i bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig tu lha mo mdzes ldan ma mthing nag gri gug dang thod pa bsnams shing /
analyzed: gang gi bstod pa'i yon tan sku la rdzogs pa'i bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig tu lha mo mdzes ldan ma mthing nag gri gug dang thod pa bsnams shing /
translated: Together with the Bhagavat, who is endowed with the qualities of praise, is the goddess Kṛiṣṇālokā, who holds a curved knife and a skull,

original: sku la 'khyud pa dang lhan cig tu gnas te /
analyzed: sku la 'khyud pa dang lhan cig tu gnas te /
translated: and who stands embracing him.

original: bdud 'dul ba'i tshul can no //
analyzed: bdud 'dul ba'i tshul can no //
translated: She is the one who has the manner of subduing the demons.

original: shar phyogs su dri za'i rigs kyi gnod sbyin 'dul bar byed de /
analyzed: shar phyogs su dri za'i rigs kyi gnod sbyin 'dul bar byed de /
translated: In the east, he subdues the yakṣa class of gandharvas.

original: dri za pho mo'i steng du khro bo bdud las rgyal bar byed pa zhes bya ba sku mdog dkar po //
analyzed: dri za pho mo'i steng du khro bo bdud las rgyal bar byed pa zhes bya ba sku mdog dkar po //
translated: Upon the male and female gandharvas, there is the wrathful one called “the Victorious One over Demons,” who is white in color,

original: phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa /
translated: has four arms,

original: rdo rje rtse lnga pa dang / kha tv'am 'dzin pa /
analyzed: rdo rje rtse lnga pa dang / kha tv'am 'dzin pa /
translated: holds a five-pronged vajra and a khaṭvāṅga,

original: 'og ma gnyis pa sdigs mdzub bcas shing yum la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: 'og ma gnyis pa sdigs mdzub bcas shing yum la 'khyud pa /
translated: and with the lower two makes a threatening gesture and embraces the mother.

original: lha mo 'od zer mdog dkar mo spu gri dang thod pa bsnams shing g-yon phyogs nas 'khril ba'o //
analyzed: lha mo 'od zer mdog dkar mo spu gri dang thod pa bsnams shing g-yon phyogs nas 'khril ba'o //
translated: The goddess is white in color, holds a curved knife and a skull, and embraces him from the left.

original: lha phyogs su gshin rje'i rigs kyi gnod sbyin 'dul bar byed pa /
analyzed: lha phyogs su gshin rje'i rigs kyi gnod sbyin 'dul bar byed pa /
translated: In the god realm, he subdues the yakṣa class of yāmas.

original: gshin rje pho mo'i steng na khro bo gzi brjid 'bar ba zhes bya ba mdog ser po /
analyzed: gshin rje pho mo'i steng na khro bo gzi brjid 'bar ba zhes bya ba mdog ser po /
translated: On top of the male and female Yama is the wrathful one called Blazing Splendor, yellow in color.

original: phyag bzhi po rdo rje dang dbyug to 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag bzhi po rdo rje dang dbyug to 'dzin pa /
translated: He has four hands, holding a vajra and a club.

original: 'og ma gnyis pa sdigs mdzub bcas shing yum la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: 'og ma gnyis pa sdigs mdzub bcas shing yum la 'khyud pa /
translated: The lower two hands make a threatening gesture and embrace the mother.

original: lha mo mdangs can ma sku mdogs ser mo zangs gri dang thod pa bsnams shing g-yon phyogs su 'khril ba'o //
analyzed: lha mo mdangs can ma sku mdogs ser mo zangs gri dang thod pa bsnams shing g-yon phyogs su 'khril ba'o //
translated: The goddess Radiant One is yellow, holds a copper knife and a skull, and embraces from the left.

original: nub phyogs su chu lha'i rigs kyi gnod sbyin 'dul bar byed pa chu lha pho mo'i steng du khro bo rngam pa'i sgra sgrogs zhes bya ba mdog dmar po /
analyzed: nub phyogs su chu lha'i rigs kyi gnod sbyin 'dul bar byed pa chu lha pho mo'i steng du khro bo rngam pa'i sgra sgrogs zhes bya ba mdog dmar po /
translated: In the west, the one who tames the yakshas of the water god family is on top of the male and female water gods. The wrathful one is called Roaring Sound, red in color.

original: phyag bzhi pa rdo rje dang sprul zhags 'dzin pa //
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa rdo rje dang sprul zhags 'dzin pa //

analyzed: bdag che ge mo 'di zhes bya ba la 'dus byas kyi dngos po 'di dang 'di stsol cig byas nas chos skyong rnams la gtor ma btang nas nyin re la ci 'dod pa'i rdzas gser gyi dong cho bdun stong bdun stong ri ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Having said, Give this and this conditioned thing to me, the one called so-and-so, one should offer a sacrificial cake to the Dharma protectors and one will obtain whatever one desires, such as seven thousand golden coins per day.

original: rgyas gdab pa dgrol bar 'dod na thal bas bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyas btab pa ni ban bon gyi byad du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas gdab pa dgrol bar 'dod na thal bas bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyas btab pa ni ban bon gyi byad du bcug pa'o //
translated: If one wishes to release a seal, one should do it with ashes.  A seal is a spell cast by a Buddhist or a Bönpo.

original: mchod pa sngon du song bas gsol te brtag pa ni /
analyzed: mchod pa sngon du song bas gsol te brtag pa ni /
translated: Having made offerings beforehand, one should request and examine.

original: rim pa drug par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa drug par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know it from the sixth chapter.

original: de dgrol ba'i thabs ni sngon du bsnyen pa rdzogs pa'i gang zag gis thab khung gru gsum bcas te drag po'i sbyin sreg byas nas de'i thal ba dang sngags pa de nyid kyi dri chu sbyar te /
analyzed: de dgrol ba'i thabs ni sngon du bsnyen pa rdzogs pa'i gang zag gis thab khung gru gsum bcas te drag po'i sbyin sreg byas nas de'i thal ba dang sngags pa de nyid kyi dri chu sbyar te /
translated: The method of releasing it is as follows: A person who has completed the preliminary practices should make a triangular hearth and perform a wrathful burnt offering. Then, mixing the ashes with the urine of the one who is sealed,

original: nag po'i phyogs kyi tshes grangs kyi dus su khrus byas na drang srong dmod mo yang bzlog go //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs kyi tshes grangs kyi dus su khrus byas na drang srong dmod mo yang bzlog go //
translated: if one bathes at the time of a lunar day of the dark half, even the curse of a sage can be averted.

original: bsrung bar 'dod na drag po'i sbyin sreg gi thal ba dang / skye ba bdun pa'i thal chen la sngags nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te /
analyzed: bsrung bar 'dod na drag po'i sbyin sreg gi thal ba dang / skye ba bdun pa'i thal chen la sngags nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas te /
translated: If one wishes to protect oneself, one should enchant twenty-one times the ashes of a fierce burnt offering or the great ash of one who has lived seven years,

original: skyabs 'gro sngon du song ba la btags na bsrung ba'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyabs 'gro sngon du song ba la btags na bsrung ba'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: and if one ties it on after having gone for refuge, it will be the best protection.

original: sgo lcags dbye bar 'dod pas yungs kar gyis bya'o zhes bya ba ni thab khung gru bzhi byas te /
analyzed: sgo lcags dbye bar 'dod pas yungs kar gyis bya'o zhes bya ba ni thab khung gru bzhi byas te /
translated: If one wishes to open a door, one should do it with mustard seed. One should make a square hearth,🔽enchant yellow mustard seed, and at the time of the full moon, make an offering to the fire of the Karavira tree.

original: yungs kar ser po sgrub pa byas la shing ka ra g'i ra'i me la zla ba rgyas pa'i dus su sbyin sreg byas pa'i tha ba dang / yungs kar bsregs pas mig nas mar blugs nas sngags brgya bzlas na 'bye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yungs kar ser po sgrub pa byas la shing ka ra g'i ra'i me la zla ba rgyas pa'i dus su sbyin sreg byas pa'i tha ba dang / yungs kar bsregs pas mig nas mar blugs nas sngags brgya bzlas na 'bye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should mix the ashes of the burnt mustard seed with one's own eye ointment, enchant it one hundred times, and apply it to one's eyes.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The eight fears are as follows:

original: me'i 'jigs pa dang chu'i 'jigs pa dang / sprul dug can gyis 'jigs pa dang / rgyal po'i chad pas 'jigs pa dang / shugs can gcan gzan gdug pas 'jigs pa dang / rdo rje 'bar bas 'jigs pa dang / dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i bar du gcod pas 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: me'i 'jigs pa dang chu'i 'jigs pa dang / sprul dug can gyis 'jigs pa dang / rgyal po'i chad pas 'jigs pa dang / shugs can gcan gzan gdug pas 'jigs pa dang / rdo rje 'bar bas 'jigs pa dang / dus ma yin par 'chi ba'i bar du gcod pas 'jigs pa dang /
translated: fear of fire, fear of water, fear of poisonous snakes, fear of royal punishment, fear of powerful wild beasts, fear of blazing vajras, up to fear of obstacles of untimely death,

original: srin po khros shing rngam pas 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: srin po khros shing rngam pas 'jigs pa'o //
translated: and fear of angry and enraged rākṣasas.

original: de la bsrung ba ni rtsi mar gyi snying po dang / zhi ba'i sbyin sreg byas pa'i thal ba dang / yungs kar la sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas te /
analyzed: de la bsrung ba ni rtsi mar gyi snying po dang / zhi ba'i sbyin sreg byas pa'i thal ba dang / yungs kar la sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas te /
translated: For that protection, use sesame oil essence, the ashes from a pacifying homa, and white mustard seeds. Recite the mantra one hundred and eight times.

original: bsrung ba'i 'khor lo'i bar du blugs te /🔽yongs su rdzogs pa'i bags pa'i mtha' mar gtums te /
analyzed: bsrung ba'i 'khor lo'i bar du blugs te / yongs su rdzogs pa'i bags pa'i mtha' mar gtums te /
translated: Put it inside the protection wheel.🔽Wrap it with the outer protection mantra.

original: @240b ma gul du btags na bsrung ba'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @240b ma gul du btags na bsrung ba'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If tied on the body, it will become supreme protection.

original: nad kyi 'jigs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dan ldan pa dang / 'dus pa dang / yams dang / rims dan /
analyzed: nad kyi 'jigs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dan ldan pa dang / 'dus pa dang / yams dang / rims dan /
translated: All dangers of disease are all of the humors of wind, bile, phlegm, and their combination, and all epidemics, contagions, smallpox, measles,

original: 'brum bu dang / shu ba dang / me dpal dang / g-yan pa la sogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: 'brum bu dang / shu ba dang / me dpal dang / g-yan pa la sogs pa thams cad do //
translated: boils, and leprosy, etc.

original: de bsrung ba ni skud pa me tog sngon po'i chus skud pa sngon por bsgyur ba la rang lha'i skur gsal bas mi dmigs pa las rdo rje'i rang bzhin rgya gram dang ldan pa'i bsrung ba'i mdud pa byas te mgul du btags na bsrung ba'i mchog tu 'gyur
analyzed: de bsrung ba ni skud pa me tog sngon po'i chus skud pa sngon por bsgyur ba la rang lha'i skur gsal bas mi dmigs pa las rdo rje'i rang bzhin rgya gram dang ldan pa'i bsrung ba'i mdud pa byas te mgul du btags na bsrung ba'i mchog tu 'gyur
translated: Protecting from them, one should make a protection knot with a cross of the nature of a vajra on a blue thread dyed with blue flower water, and having visualized oneself as the deity, and having made it invisible, one should tie it around one's neck. It will become the supreme protection.

original: ro // byis pa gdon gyis nyen pa zhes bya ba ni gdon gyi za 'phro'o //
analyzed: ro // byis pa gdon gyis nyen pa zhes bya ba ni gdon gyi za 'phro'o //
translated: Children afflicted by spirits are those who are possessed by spirits.

original: thams cad ni pho mo'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni pho mo'o //
translated: All are male and female.

original: de bsrung ba ni tshon sna lnga'i skud pa la bdag nyid lha'i sku dang ldan pas 'od kha dog lnga dang ldan pa'i 'od kyi gong bu'i nang du aom h'um sv'a aam h'a zhes bya ba bsams te /
analyzed: de bsrung ba ni tshon sna lnga'i skud pa la bdag nyid lha'i sku dang ldan pas 'od kha dog lnga dang ldan pa'i 'od kyi gong bu'i nang du aom h'um sv'a aam h'a zhes bya ba bsams te /
translated: To protect it, on a thread of five colors, one who is endowed with the body of the deity imagines Om Hum Sva A Ham in the midst of a ball of light endowed with five-colored rays.

original: rab tu gnas pa byas la de la skyabs su 'gror bcug ste /
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa byas la de la skyabs su 'gror bcug ste /
translated: Having performed the consecration, one should cause [the thread] to be worn around the neck.

original: mgul du btags na bsrung ba'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgul du btags na bsrung ba'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be the best protection.

original: chom rkun bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni lam du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i dus su'o //🔽sas bya'o zhes bya ba ni dang po ma la sa nas gom pa 'dor ba'i tshe skyes pa'i g-yas /
analyzed: chom rkun bzlog pa zhes bya ba ni lam du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i dus su'o // sas bya'o zhes bya ba ni dang po ma la sa nas gom pa 'dor ba'i tshe skyes pa'i g-yas /
translated: As for repel thieves, this is done at the time of setting out on a journey, and so forth.

original: bud med kyi g-yon nas srin lag ma gtogs pa'i lag pas sa blangs te /
analyzed: bud med kyi g-yon nas srin lag ma gtogs pa'i lag pas sa blangs te /
translated: One should take earth means that when one first sets out on a journey, one takes earth with one's right hand, if one is a man, and with one's left hand, if one is a woman, except in the case of a woman who is menstruating.

original: sngags lan bdun btab nas byung ba'i tshe byams pa dang ldan pa'i bsam pas gdong du gtor na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags lan bdun btab nas byung ba'i tshe byams pa dang ldan pa'i bsam pas gdong du gtor na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having enchanted it seven times, when one arrives at one's destination, if one scatters it on one's face with a thought endowed with loving-kindness, one will be at peace.

original: dug la ni rtsva ku shas byab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dug rang la mi byab po /
analyzed: dug la ni rtsva ku shas byab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dug rang la mi byab po /
translated: For poison, one should perform the sprinkling with kuśa grass.

original: dug gis na ba la ni rtsva ku sha bsregs pa dang / yun ring po lon pa'i dmar po'i sa khru gang 'og nas 'jam po blud de lo brgyad pa'i chus sbyar nas sngags btab ste btang na 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dug gis na ba la ni rtsva ku sha bsregs pa dang / yun ring po lon pa'i dmar po'i sa khru gang 'og nas 'jam po blud de lo brgyad pa'i chus sbyar nas sngags btab ste btang na 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For one who is poisoned, one should give a burnt kuśa grass and a red earth that is one cubit in size, old, soft, and mixed with water from an eight-year-old well.

original: bdag bsrung ba la yid kyis zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du lhar mos pa'o //
analyzed: bdag bsrung ba la yid kyis zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du lhar mos pa'o //
translated: For self-protection, one should do it mentally, meaning one should imagine oneself as the deity at all times.

original: yang na chu la sngags btab pa ste bya'o //
analyzed: yang na chu la sngags btab pa ste bya'o //
translated: Or one should do it with water that has been enchanted.

original: gzhan la ni gong gi skud pa so sos bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni gong gi skud pa so sos bya'o //
translated: For others, one should do it with the individual cords mentioned above.

original: las de thams cad la sngags brjod pa ni gcig gam /
analyzed: las de thams cad la sngags brjod pa ni gcig gam /
translated: For all those rites, the mantra should be recited once,

original: gsum mam / lan bcu bzhi'am nyi shu rtsa gcig gam brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum mam / lan bcu bzhi'am nyi shu rtsa gcig gam brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: or three times, or fourteen times, or twenty-one times, or one hundred and eight times. It will be accomplished.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje dang / 'khor rnams la de skad ces bka' stsal nas byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje dang / @241a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje dang / 'khor rnams la de skad ces bka' stsal nas byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje dang / @241a * //
translated: The Blessed One, having spoken thus to the Bodhisattva Vajrapani and the assembly, the Bodhisattva Vajrapani,

original: bdud dpung dang bcas pa rjes su yi rangs te /
analyzed: bdud dpung dang bcas pa rjes su yi rangs te /
translated: together with the army of Mara, rejoiced.

original: yi rangs nas bstan pa la 'khod do //🔽drag po gsum ni sa bla sa stengs /
analyzed: yi rangs nas bstan pa la 'khod do // drag po gsum ni sa bla sa stengs /
translated: Having rejoiced, they entered the doctrine.🔽The three fierce ones are the upper, middle, and lower realms.

original: sa 'og gsum drag ni ma rungs pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'og gsum drag ni ma rungs pa'o //
translated: Fierce means unruly.

original: de la 'dul bar dus la bab par gzigs nas bstan pa la bkod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dul bar dus la bab par gzigs nas bstan pa la bkod pa'o //
translated: Seeing that the time had come to subdue them, he established them in the doctrine.

original: de'i 'grel pa bdag gis brtsams //
analyzed: de'i 'grel pa bdag gis brtsams //
translated: I composed a commentary on that.

original: lung dang man ngag rtogs pas de don bsgrubs //
analyzed: lung dang man ngag rtogs pas de don bsgrubs //
translated: Having realized the scriptures and instructions, I accomplished their meaning.

original: 'bras bu bdud rtsi lta bu bdag gis 'thungs //
analyzed: 'bras bu bdud rtsi lta bu bdag gis 'thungs //
translated: I drank the nectar-like result.

original: sing ga la yi yul du de thob nas //
analyzed: sing ga la yi yul du de thob nas //
translated: Having attained that in the land of Singha,

original: phyi rabs rnams la phan phyir de don brtsams //
analyzed: phyi rabs rnams la phan phyir de don brtsams //
translated: I composed this for the benefit of future generations.

original: mos shing 'jug pas phyag na rdo rje'i zhal mthong shog / drag po gsum 'dul zhes bya ba'i rgyud kyi 'grel ba bdud rtsi myu gu zhes bya ba /
analyzed: mos shing 'jug pas phyag na rdo rje'i zhal mthong shog / drag po gsum 'dul zhes bya ba'i rgyud kyi 'grel ba bdud rtsi myu gu zhes bya ba /
translated: The commentary called The Sprout of Nectar on the tantra called The Subjugation of the Three Haughty Ones.

original: dngos grub brnyes pa'i dz'a ba ri pas sa ba ri pa la man ngag tu zhus pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dngos grub brnyes pa'i dz'a ba ri pas sa ba ri pa la man ngag tu zhus pa rdzogs so /
translated: The oral instructions requested by Savaripa from the accomplished Jābir are complete.

original: // / pandi ta de nyid dang pandi ta de ba pu n+ya ma ti dang / lo ts'a ba chos kyi bzang pos bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: // / pandi ta de nyid dang pandi ta de ba pu n+ya ma ti dang / lo ts'a ba chos kyi bzang pos bsgyur ba'o//
translated: By the pandit himself, the pandit Devapunyamati, and the translator Chökyi Zangpo.
